main_text:
Moral Philosophy || Summary
4.4 Summary


Sylvan’s work in moral theory helped pioneer the rise of
environmental philosophy as a new sub-discipline and connected
environmental issues with broader moral issues as well as issues in
political and social philosophy. Drawing on other work in metaphysics
and logic, he sought new non-anthropocentric moral foundations,
heavily critical of both traditional ethics and emerging alternatives
that lacked clarity and rigour.
